paragraphs.content: Chapter 7
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 7

paragraphs.content: A good name is better than precious ointment; and the day of death than the day of one’s birth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A good name is better than precious ointment; and the day of death than the day of one’s birth.

paragraphs.content: ¶ It is better to go to the house of mourning, than to go to the house of feasting: for that is the end of all men; and the living will lay it to his heart.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ It is better to go to the house of mourning, than to go to the house of feasting: for that is the end of all men; and the living will lay it to his heart.

paragraphs.content: Sorrow is better than laughter: for by the sadness of the countenance the heart is made better.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Sorrow is better than laughter: for by the sadness of the countenance the heart is made better.

paragraphs.content: The heart of the wise is in the house of mourning; but the heart of fools is in the house of mirth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The heart of the wise is in the house of mourning; but the heart of fools is in the house of mirth.

paragraphs.content: It is better to hear the rebuke of the wise, than for a man to hear the song of fools.
paragraphs.contentHtml: It is better to hear the rebuke of the wise, than for a man to hear the song of fools.

paragraphs.content: For as the crackling of thorns under a pot, so is the laughter of the fool: this also is vanity.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For as the crackling of thorns under a pot, so is the laughter of the fool: this also is vanity.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Surely oppression maketh a wise man mad; and a gift destroyeth the heart.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Surely oppression maketh a wise man mad; and a gift destroyeth the heart.

paragraphs.content: Better is the end of a thing than the beginning thereof: and the patient in spirit is better than the proud in spirit.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Better is the end of a thing than the beginning thereof: and the patient in spirit is better than the proud in spirit.

paragraphs.content: Be not hasty in thy spirit to be angry: for anger resteth in the bosom of fools.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Be not hasty in thy spirit to be angry: for anger resteth in the bosom of fools.

paragraphs.content: Say not thou, What is the cause that the former days were better than these? for thou dost not inquire wisely concerning this.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Say not thou, What is the cause that the former days were better than these? for thou dost not inquire wisely concerning this.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Wisdom is good with an inheritance: and by it there is profit to them that see the sun.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Wisdom is good with an inheritance: and by it there is profit to them that see the sun.

paragraphs.content: For wisdom is a defence, and money is a defence: but the excellency of knowledge is, that wisdom giveth life to them that have it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For wisdom is a defence, and money is a defence: but the excellency of knowledge is, that wisdom giveth life to them that have it.

paragraphs.content: Consider the work of God: for who can make that straight, which he hath made crooked?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Consider the work of God: for who can make that straight, which he hath made crooked?

paragraphs.content: In the day of prosperity be joyful, but in the day of adversity consider: God also hath set the one over against the other, to the end that man should find nothing after him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: In the day of prosperity be joyful, but in the day of adversity consider: God also hath set the one over against the other, to the end that man should find nothing after him.

paragraphs.content: All things have I seen in the days of my vanity: there is a just man that perisheth in his righteousness, and there is a wicked man that prolongeth his life in his wickedness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: All things have I seen in the days of my vanity: there is a just man that perisheth in his righteousness, and there is a wicked man that prolongeth his life in his wickedness.

paragraphs.content: Be not righteous over much; neither make thyself over wise: why shouldest thou destroy thyself?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Be not righteous over much; neither make thyself over wise: why shouldest thou destroy thyself?

paragraphs.content: Be not over much wicked, neither be thou foolish: why shouldest thou die before thy time?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Be not over much wicked, neither be thou foolish: why shouldest thou die before thy time?

paragraphs.content: It is good that thou shouldest take hold of this; yea, also from this withdraw not thine hand: for he that feareth God shall come forth of them all.
paragraphs.contentHtml: It is good that thou shouldest take hold of this; yea, also from this withdraw not thine hand: for he that feareth God shall come forth of them all.

paragraphs.content: Wisdom strengtheneth the wise more than ten mighty men which are in the city.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wisdom strengtheneth the wise more than ten mighty men which are in the city.

paragraphs.content: For there is not a just man upon earth, that doeth good, and sinneth not.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For there is not a just man upon earth, that doeth good, and sinneth not.

paragraphs.content: Also take no heed unto all words that are spoken; lest thou hear thy servant curse thee:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Also take no heed unto all words that are spoken; lest thou hear thy servant curse thee:

paragraphs.content: For oftentimes also thine own heart knoweth that thou thyself likewise hast cursed others.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For oftentimes also thine own heart knoweth that thou thyself likewise hast cursed others.

paragraphs.content: ¶ All this have I proved by wisdom: I said, I will be wise; but it was far from me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ All this have I proved by wisdom: I said, I will be wise; but it was far from me.

paragraphs.content: That which is far off, and exceeding deep, who can find it out?
paragraphs.contentHtml: That which is far off, and exceeding deep, who can find it out?

paragraphs.content: I applied mine heart to know, and to search, and to seek out wisdom, and the reason of things, and to know the wickedness of folly, even of foolishness and madness:
paragraphs.contentHtml: I applied mine heart to know, and to search, and to seek out wisdom, and the reason of things, and to know the wickedness of folly, even of foolishness and madness:

paragraphs.content: And I find more bitter than death the woman, whose heart is snares and nets, and her hands as bands: whoso pleaseth God shall escape from her; but the sinner shall be taken by her.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And I find more bitter than death the woman, whose heart is snares and nets, and her hands as bands: whoso pleaseth God shall escape from her; but the sinner shall be taken by her.

paragraphs.content: Behold, this have I found, saith the preacher, counting one by one, to find out the account:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, this have I found, saith the preacher, counting one by one, to find out the account:

paragraphs.content: Which yet my soul seeketh, but I find not: one man among a thousand have I found; but a woman among all those have I not found.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Which yet my soul seeketh, but I find not: one man among a thousand have I found; but a woman among all those have I not found.

paragraphs.content: Lo, this only have I found, that God hath made man upright; but they have sought out many inventions.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lo, this only have I found, that God hath made man upright; but they have sought out many inventions.
